pullRequest.body:
Add features to `cache` and cleanup code:

* accept paths `Mathlib/Init.lean` and modules `Mathlib.Init` likewise
* accept folders in the form `Mathlib/Data` or `Mathlib.Data` and does a directory walk to find all`.lean` files therein
* enable partial cache retrieval in downstream projects: `lake exe cache get MyProject.Basic` downloads only the relevant cache to build `MyProject/Basic.lean`
* throw error if sources contain a build loop.
* cleanup
  * internally cache now works with the module names as keys (used paths before)
  * eliminate need of parsing the `lake_manifest.json`, use the Lean search path from `LEAN_PATH` instead.
  * eliminate most hard-coded file paths, generating them from the module name with `Lean.findLean`
  * add documentation

---

- replaces: #21195
- should address: #8767
- should address: #20568

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [85459349ee](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21238/commits/85459349ee75a10312a1acb37164244ebfe73cbf)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HashMemo.filterByNames`
`+ Name.fromComponents`
`+ NameHashMap`
`+ clean`
`+ contains`
`+ getCleanSearchPath`
`+ isInLeanCore`
`+ isPartOfMathlibCache`
`+ parseArgs`
`+ withoutParent`
`- HashMap`
`- HashMemo.filterByFilePaths`
`- PackageDirs`
`- System.FilePath.withoutParent`
`- getPackageDirs`
`- isMathlibRoot`
`- isPathFromMathlib`
`- mathlibDepPath`
`- mkDir`
`- roots`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks for the PR - the PR description looks great! Is there a way you can split this into more incremental pieces? (I could certainly try to review smaller parts, but I won't find time for a +450 -250 lines PR this or the next week.)

Im on vacation next week, so might not respond much.

I can split some trivial cleanup out into a seperate PR; I believe the bulk will still be quite a bit to review.

What would be an appropriate time?

Do we need to allow for some form of backwards compatible changes??

(EDITED) It can be changed any time and just invalidates all the cache once.

The advantage of not having the change yet, is that all previous cache is still valid, so one can easily merge this branch into any other branch and test things.
Actually, this change is basically equivalent to a lean-toolchain bump.

Feels a bit overkill. Can you just `take l (l.length - 3)`?

I guess we're going to need `dropRight` and `takeRight` eventually.

```
return sp.map fun path =>
    System.mkFilePath (path.components |> fun p => p.take (p.length - 3))
```
it does loop over each path's components twice this way, but honestly these aren't super long.
Let's use named fields, not the anonymous constructor, for readability here.
I think `normalize` doesn't actually do what you expect and does not handle `./.` correctly

pullRequest.title: feat(Cache): enable partial cache in downstream projects
